message.content:
cs.AR, cs.CV, cs.SY, cs.ET, cs.NE

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-categories of cs.AR (Hardware Architecture), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.ET (Embedded Systems), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) because it proposes a hardware streaming architecture for accelerating convolution and pooling computations for deep CNNs, which is optimized for energy efficiency and designed for resource-limited scenarios such as mobile devices, IoT, and UAVs. The paper also introduces image and feature decomposition techniques to optimize memory access patterns for an arbitrary size of image and number of features within limited on-chip SRAM capacity. These topics are relevant to the aforementioned sub-categories.
